channel.title: Personal Website of Daniel Escudero on Personal Website and Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Personal Website of Daniel Escudero on Personal Website and Blog

item.title: About
item.description: Daniel Escudero Hello! Welcome to my homepage. I am Daniel Escudero. Since September 2021 I am a cryptography researcher at JP Morgan AI Research. Prior to this, starting on May 2017 until August 2021, I was PhD student at the Cryptography and Security group at Aarhus University, Denmark, working under the supervision of Ivan Damgård, Jesper Buus Nielsen and Peter Scholl. I obtained my Bachelor's degree in Mathematics from Universidad Nacional de Colombia in 2016 where I had the valuable opportunity to work in a research project on Multivariate Public Key Cryptography during the last two years of my studies.

item.title: Dissemination
item.description: A Crash Course on MPC I am working on a series of posts explaining MPC from the ground up. These can be found in our blog, The Sugar Beet: Applied MPC. The following are the current posts online: Part 0, Introduction Part 1, Basic Terminology and Essential Results Part 2, Two-Party Computation using Beaver/Multiplication Triples Part 3, Shamir Secret-Sharing

item.title: Other
item.description: Music I enjoy playing and composing music. Daniel Escudero · Daniel Escudero

item.title: Publications
item.description: Peer-Reviewed Publications 2021 Improved Single-Round Secure Multiplication Using Regenerating Codes Authors: Mark Abspoel, Ronald Cramer, Daniel Escudero, Ivan Damgård and Chaoping Xing Asiacrypt 2021 Link Information-Theoretically Secure MPC against Mixed Dynamic Adversaries Authors: Ivan Damgård, Daniel Escudero, Divya Ravi TCC 2021 Improved Threshold Signatures, Proactive Secret Sharing, and Input Certification from LSS Isomorphisms

item.title: Talks
item.description: 2021 Fantastic Four: Honest-Majority Four-Party Secure Computation With Malicious Security USENIX 2021 Virtual Conference August 2021 2020 Efficient Protocols for Oblivious Linear Function Evaluation from Ring-LWE TPMPC 2020: Theory and Practice of Multi-Party Computation Workshops Virtual Conference June 2020 PRIMAL: A Framework for Secure Evaluation of Neural Networks

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I've been a teaching assistant in the following courses. Machine Learning (Aarhus University, fall 2020) Computer Architecture, OSs and Networking (Aarhus University, spring 2019 and spring 2020) Distributed Systems and Security (Aarhus University, fall 2018) Computability and Logic (Aarhus University, spring 2018) Machine Learning (Aarhus University, fall 2017) Vector and Analytic Geometry (UNAL, 2016) Basic Mathematics (UNAL, 2015)
